website_summaries.verdict: A mix that contains nuts and fruit as well as seeds.
pros: This premium blend contains peanuts, cranberries, papaya, raisins, sunflower and more, all enriched with vitamins and minerals
cons: Raisins are toxic to cats and dogs, so make sure they can’t scrounge from any that fall from the feeder

customer_reviews.title: Doubling the price right now isn't helping
customer_reviews.text: My wild birds LOVE this seed. The prices you are charging now are highway robbery! NO ONE CAN AFFORD THIS RIGHT NOW!
customer_reviews.author: L. Walker

customer_reviews.title: High Quality No Waste
customer_reviews.text: Our local stores don’t sell anything near this quality. There are no “fillers” that will go to waste - every scrap of this food consistently disappeared out of the feeder this summer with zero waste. We were feeding towhees, grosbeaks, Stellar’s jays, finches, and several smaller colorful songbirds. The birds loved this seed mix. Yes, it is expensive. However, I tried a couple of other cheaper brands and we ended up with moths several times, along with wasted “filler” materials that the birds would not eat. Will be sticking with this mix from now on for summer feeding.
customer_reviews.author: CallOut5

customer_reviews.title: WHAT "FANCY"BIRDS EAT!
customer_reviews.text: Yum! My birds have gone CRAZY over this! A plethora of dried fruits, nuts (like walnuts & peanuts) and seeds! Seriously, it looks good enough to eat myself! I recommended it to my sister and now she's buying it! Highly recommend this birdseed to ANYONE who wants to SPOIL their birds! Super happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonlove

customer_reviews.title: Birds LOVE LOVE LOVE this seed
customer_reviews.text: The birds love this seed. Within 2 days I have many beautiful songs birds and doves in my yard. I love seeing and hearing them. One problem, there are raisins in the seed. Dogs cannot have raisins made from grapes. My dogs like to eat up what is on the ground from the feeders and I’m concerned about that. Next bag I will make sure does not have raisins.
customer_reviews.author: Gail A.

customer_reviews.title: My birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this! Everything in the package looked good, nothing gross inside. Looks almost like trail mix. The birds (and squirrels) go crazy for it. I've had blue jays, cardinals, two different kinds of woodpeckers, chickadees, purple finches, nunhatches and mourning doves. I would definitely try to hang your feeders up high and use a squirrel baffle. This stuff is too expensive to give it away to the squirrels. While I was filling my feeders, I had the bag opened and about 7 feet away. When I turned around a squirrel was trying to get into the open bag while I was standing right there!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong blend, birds and fowl don’t like nearly as much
customer_reviews.text: I noticed right away there were no papaya pieces & many dates with the pit in tact with the recent purchase. The feeders are not emptied out as before. A tel tel sign the birds are not liking this blend so much. The Chickadees barely come around anymore. With the necessary online purchases to social distance, it’s ‘iffy’ for future online purchases. Some is better than none.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy V.

customer_reviews.title: Wild Birds Love this Food
customer_reviews.text: This mixture attracts so many beautiful birds. I live in the Northeast and I attract all kinds of songbirds when I am using this feed. It is such a wonderful sight to have so many beautiful birds to watch and observe. I keep ordering it and more often than I use to because more and more birds are stopping by to feast.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Collier

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Changed Person
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the wild birds in our yard (especially the male cardinal who has sat on the fence staring at me for the last two years). They seem to love it (as does El Destructo, the chipmunk). So, I decided to see what they love so much about it. I have to say, I am a changed person! I love the way this tastes, and it has just the right crunch! The resealable bag really keeps it fresh. Now, I can sit outside with the wild birds and El Destructo while eating the same nutritious food they do! I feel like a new person!
customer_reviews.author: kkccmckay

customer_reviews.title: Extra price worth it
customer_reviews.text: We spent the extra on this bird seed to attract more chickadees and nut hatches. It worked! They seem to love it. We love having them! Updated 2/2018: The chickadees are still coming and they love it as do the squirrels! However, none of the critters like the millet. It’s left in big piles after they finish everything else. This year we do not have any dark-eyed juncoes, and I guess the millet is for them.
customer_reviews.author: RainyBadger

customer_reviews.title: The Birds Love It
customer_reviews.text: The birds seem to love it and can't get enough, all birds, all sizes. I guess there's something for eeryone, even the squirrels like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good quality food
customer_reviews.text: Bought to try with the birds in the yard and it attracted many different kinds. A little pricy but good quality food.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Quick

customer_reviews.title: No wasted fillers
customer_reviews.text: The birds, chipmunks, squirrels, and wild rabbits all find something to eat from this bag. I toss in some peanut pieces too. It's a little pri ey, but none of it is easted.
customer_reviews.author: Pastelrain

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it
customer_reviews.text: My birds loved this birdseed. I got a lot more birds using this seed. They like the fruit and nuts. Its a little pricey though.
customer_reviews.author: Lindalsc

customer_reviews.title: Great Songbird Seed
customer_reviews.text: Love this seed, it attracted so many more birds, and they don't waste alot like some seed bags do. I will definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: The birds love it. You need to make sure the feed can fit through the sections in the feeder be because some of the pieces are large.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Ottaway

customer_reviews.title: Brings all kinds of birds.
customer_reviews.text: Birds love this food. Brings in a variety of different birds. Probably best to use a squirrel proof feeder because the squirrels love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Nice variety
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit pricey, but it seems to be a nice variety of different, fruits, nuts and seed.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great deal of waste!
customer_reviews.text: This food includes a massive amt of thistle/niger seeds. I have very large variety of birds since I have a large platform feeder. The bottom is covered in those because NONE of my birds eat them. Not sure if poor quality or what, but I have to brush them out of the tray a few times a day. Basically you pay a lot and get junk. Going back to Wild Delight... expensive but every single bit of it is eaten so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: DebraDownSthTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Birds will love it!
customer_reviews.text: The birds love this birdseed. Not full of junk filler either.
customer_reviews.author: Nett

customer_reviews.title: My birds LOVE this seed
customer_reviews.text: I have never had so many birds. They love this seed. I have woodpeckers, cardinals, chickadees, blue jays, other... I will continue to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C.

customer_reviews.title: Birds love this
customer_reviews.text: This birdseed has a wide assortment of different nuts it in. The birds flock to the feeder in the morning and keep coming all day.
customer_reviews.author: robyn agu

customer_reviews.title: My birds love this nut and fruit blend
customer_reviews.text: The birds in my yard love this nut and Fruit mixture. Except for the filler. (Tiny round seeds) They don't touch it. I would like to find this blend without the filler.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Pinson

customer_reviews.title: BIRD FOOD BAG OPENED IN AMAZON BOX
customer_reviews.text: When I opened my Amazon Box, the plastic bag had been opened and the birdfood was all outside the bag, and all over the inside of the Amazon Box
customer_reviews.author: bill minniear

customer_reviews.title: Attracts a variety of birds.
customer_reviews.text: Birdies love it and has little to no waste when they are at the feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Rolinda Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it
customer_reviews.text: Very popular at the feeder with many different birds, including woodpeckers
customer_reviews.author: susan15

customer_reviews.title: Lots of happy birds
customer_reviews.text: I had an increased number of birds visiting my balcony the past month.
customer_reviews.author: antoinette palmieri

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Almost all sunflower seed and millet. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Birds absolutely LOVE this birdseed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used for feeding woodpeckers, cardinals, blue jays, nuthatches, and all other variety of birds. They love this food.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Keith

customer_reviews.title: Scotts Colorful Bird Seed
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that Scotts out numbers the cheaper brands of bird seed many times over. I ran out of Scotts and used some other wild bird seed until I could buy more....... needless to say most of the birds did not return!! It definitely atracts 2x more happier and colorful birds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My birds love it but have now had to put them on a diet as they seem to consume more than I can afford. I have tried cheaper seed and fewer birds come. Highly recommend any of the Scott's brand bird seed.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: WE R ALL HAPPY.
customer_reviews.text: I MIX THIS WITH THE CHEAPER BIRDFOOD TO MAKE A TREAT FOR ALL THE WILD BIRDS.THEY EMPTY THE BIRDFEEDER EVERYDAY. WE R ALL HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence J. Kearse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Birds are happy and sad to say so are the squirrels!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Kane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Our "feathered friends" have brought many friends to enjoy this bird seed!
customer_reviews.author: RuthAnn Vernon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time, a bit stale smelling this time. Unusual. Normaly smells quite fresh. Seems older then normal.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Glotz

customer_reviews.title: Our Outdoor Babies Love This!
customer_reviews.text: Such a wonderful product for Squirrels, Jay's, Crows, and little birds too. The bits that fall off get eaten by the wild ducks, and even a rat family that lives under our shed. Yes, I know, "ewww, rats" but they are part of the food chain and deserve to live as well. We have hunting birds that feed on them occasionally, owls, falcons and hawks, so they never over populate. Every bit of this food gets eaten, and we get so much enjoyment out of watching them!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Birds love it, simple delivery
customer_reviews.text: Delivery to door - no lugging/lifting through store into car. Birds love it.
customer_reviews.author: JoE

customer_reviews.title: The birds liked it but...
customer_reviews.text: Well, the birds definitely liked the seed. However after filling up the feeder twice, it seemed to be the exact same kinds of birds who liked the other two brands I've tried. I didn't notice a greater influx in songbirds, but still saw lots of blue jays, cardinals, finches as well as the ever present squirrels. I did have to fill up the feeder a day earlier than usual and there was less filler in the package so that's a point in it's favor. I also liked the easy screw on cap and spout, it definitely helped with the pouring when filling up the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Eohany

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bird attractant
customer_reviews.text: Yard full of birds now. Love it. They seem to really love this brand and flavor.
customer_reviews.author: MMOORE

customer_reviews.title: More variety of birds
customer_reviews.text: I have more variety of birds now that I have this, just like it claims.
customer_reviews.author: Candi G

customer_reviews.title: Birds seem to like it
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for the taste, but there hasn't been a shortage of birds (and squirrels!) stopping by the feeder. The easy pour spout on the bag makes it so much easier to pour without having to use a funnel, cup or other plastic pouring device. The bag was just big enough for 2 fills of the feeder with a little left over. The one thing I noticed was there are no corn or sunflower fillers in these bags. It was berries seeds of all sizes and no sticks or other debris.
customer_reviews.author: Hiawhatha

customer_reviews.title: Great, hearty blend of seed
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Great bird feed. It was a real hearty mix of feed and attracted finches like nothing we've seen. We routinely put feed out for the birds - we enjoy seeing and hearing them around the house - and this might be the best feed we've used. Nice product and in a nice pouch. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Bird Seed
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get any songbirds, but the squirrels & Blue Jays loved it. A little expensive to feed the squirrels, I will stick w. peanuts and my regular bird seed w.sunflower seed blend. The container is nice w/ the twist off cap, prevents the usual spills I get ( 3 nosey cats).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer 2

customer_reviews.title: Poisonous for dogs
customer_reviews.text: Songbird Selections 11980 Multi-Bird Wild Bird... Scotts It has raisons in it which are poisonous for dogs!! Can't use it in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Marylee S.

customer_reviews.title: Best bird food I ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bird food I have ever used. It draws so many different kinds of birds and so many birds. The birds on the feeder throw some out but the ground is covered with other birds and squirrels eating from the ground too. My yard is so busy with birds, there is just no comparison to other feeds I have used. I only wish I could find it in larger bags as I go through a lot of feed.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Pesticide Pellets
customer_reviews.text: Scott's was convicted of selling bird seed coated with pesticides known to kill birds for years, and falsifying documents to cover it up. They did this to prolong shelf life. I did not know this until after I bought the product, but will NOT use any of their seed in my bird feeders now or ever again. Please read about how this company has been knowingly selling poisoned seed for years before you buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Fons

customer_reviews.title: Scotts Miracle-Gro - $12.5 Million in Criminal Fines and Civil Penalties
customer_reviews.text: Scotts used/does use pesticides Actellic 5E and Storcide II in their bird feed. Do not get their seed, it could kill the birds.
customer_reviews.author: BrianTop Contributor: Board Games

product_meta.title: Audubon Park Songbird Selections 11980 Multi Wild Bird Food with Fruits and Nuts, 15 lb
product_meta.description: Size:15 lbSongbird Selections 11980 Multi-Bird Wild Bird Food with Fruits and Nuts, 15-Pound. Plenty of mixed nuts & real fruit to satisfy even the most finicky birds. Premium blend of sunflower, peanuts, millet, raisins, papaya, mixed nuts, cranberries and flaxseed oil (no fillers). NutriThrive enriched with vitamins and minerals to support immunity, energy and reproductive health. Attracts chickadees, cardinals, nuthatches, titmice, jays and woodpeckers. Easy to reseal bag for no-hassle storage! Family owned, American made. We love birds and care for them like no one else. Our family has been making the safest, highest quality food for backyard wildlife since 1982. We make it easy for you to attract and feed the birds you love. You can count us for safe, natural and nutritious wild bird food that keeps backyard birds coming back for more.
feature_bullets: Plenty of mixed nuts & real fruit to satisfy even the most finicky birds
Premium blend of sunflower, peanuts, millet, raisins, papaya, mixed nuts, cranberries and flaxseed oil (no fillers)
NutriThrive enriched with vitamins and minerals to support immunity, energy and reproductive health
Attracts chickadees, cardinals, nuthatches, titmice, jays and woodpeckers
Easy to reseal bag for no-hassle storage!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars184 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
